content.body: Oh hai
Start logging you!
Let's see how long it lasts
hey, it's working now
Yeah, the magic part
have you always been running krijn and krijnh as separate users? I thought the logging used to be done on the same machine you used
No, usually I'm not here
http://icanhascheezburger.com/2009/07/03/funny-pictures-sky-hmm/
[03:26]  <MikeSmith> about the future-of-XHTML confusion, maybe it would help for someone in the group to edit a "XHTML5 and HTML5" Note to make things clear
I'm 30% through. I hope to have finish tonight (Montreal time).
karlcow: excellent
Maybe someone could volunteer to provide gap logs for whenever krinj falls out of the channel
Yeah, if anybody has the log for the last day(s), just e-mail them to me
hsivonen: you planning to announce/blog about html5.enable support in nightlies?
(since I notice it's already been mentioned on the whatwg list)
MikeSmith: Was your "for now" answer meaning until chaals in back?
gsnedders: yeah
MikeSmith: yes, when comment end bang is on mozilla-central
hsivonen: OK, I saw that you had checked that into v.nu repository
MikeSmith: can't do the same with m-c without r&sr
MikeSmith: so I have anolis spitting out a document that looks like a w3c working draft. It's not clear to me which software changes the dates and/or formats it to look like an editor's draft
do you know?
sayrer_: about anolis, gsnedders would be the one to ask
oh, right, sorry
but basically, it just needs to point at the ED CSS stylesheet
oh ok
hsivonen, when did the html5.enable pref get added to Firefox nightles?
http://www.w3.org/StyleSheets/TR/W3C-ED
MikeSmith: also, you asked me to create a new directory in the repo. you want it next to /html-design-principles etc?
Lachy: on Monday
don't want to create a directory in the wrong place, since cvs is pretty defective with misplaced directories
sayrer_: yep, next to html-design-principles/ etc.

sayrer_: Yeah, as MikeSmith says, it needs to point to the style sheet. There is one option that exists for compatibility with the CSS WG's postprocessor which tries to work out what style sheet to use, but it's a really fucked up whacky algorithm.
gsnedders: is that -w3c-crazy?
(Basically, you don't want to use it.)
sayyeah
sayrer_: yeah, even
ok, what about the date substittutions?
sayrer_: They should work from [DATE]
oh, maybe my header file is a little jacked up
ok
(or [CDATE], or [YEAR])
sayrer_: Got a copy of it online anywhere?
not yet
[DATE: foo] should also work
installing lxml on OS X
not so fun
I think, again for compat, it allows [DATE, followed by anything, until ]
sayrer_: http://pimpmyspec.net exists too
I tried it, but it timed out
blames jgraham
so I went for local anolis
it's working now
the recipe to build with macports libxml actually works
unlike every other page I found on the internet
heh
I remember having fun at TPAC getting it to work on Marcos's laptop
(Whereas I have always had macports installed on the computers I use)
I have macports, just not libxml
er, had
so it wasn't too bad
I have other things that have libxml as a dep :)
I've heard there are projects using it :)
Just a couple :)
goes back to less productive stuff like writing in his diary
Hixie: which major mode do you use for editing the spec?
looks like the decision to pull the plug on the XHTML2 WG boosted HTML5 questions on stackoverflow
I wonder if that means there were people previously stiill unsure about whether XHTML2 was relevant or not?
Hixie: about DOMTokenList, maybe the spec should mention how to deal with empty string tokens, like raising INVALID_CHARACTER_ERR.
hober: text-mode
syp_: send mail please :-)
http://arstechnica.com/open-source/news/2009/07/decoding-the-html-5-video-codec-debate.ars
that's one of the best articles about the video codec issues I've read recently
